availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, carpenter. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Duncan. Father of William Duncan, Mary A. Duncan, Albert Duncan, George W. Duncan, Julia Duncan, Millard Fillmore Duncan, Thomas H. Duncan, and Susan Duncan. Carpenter in Carter County in 1850. Carpenter in Carter County in 1860. Carpenter in Carter County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 244A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 261.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Precinct 1, p. 82A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Carter County, KY, October 1863, p. 38, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Allen Duncan (1819-1895)," Memorial #134343305, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/134343305 (accessed January 16, 2020).
